text: Tiziano Pasquali (born 14 July 1994) is an Italian rugby union footballer who plays for Treviso. He plays as a prop. Pasquali came through the Leicester Tigers academy system to make his debut in the 2013–14 LV Cup. He attended Merchiston Castle School with current Scottish international Sam Hidalgo-Clyne and London Irish scrum half Scott Steele.http://www.scotsman.com/sport/merchiston-castle-38-10-george-heriot-s- international-half-backs-provide-platform-for-merchiston-win-1-1497977 In 2012 and 2013, Pasquali was named in the Italy Under 20 squad. On 18 August 2019, he was named in the final 31-man squad for the 2019 Rugby World Cup.https://federugby.it/index.php?option=com_content&view;=article&id;=13753:italrugby- conor-oshea-annuncia-i-31-giocatori-convocati-per-il- mondiale&catid;=252:slide&Itemid;=811 Tiziano Pasquali ==References== == External links == * Leicester Tigers Profile Category:1994 births Category:Living people Category:Rugby union props Category:Italian rugby union players Category:Leicester Tigers players Category:Sportspeople from Rome Category:Italian expatriate rugby union players Category:Italian expatriate sportspeople in England Category:Expatriate rugby union players in England Category:Italy international rugby union players
title: Tiziano Pasquali
